name: Promise vs. Fulfillment Detector
description: Detects discrepancies between historical or institutional promises made to marginalized populations and the actual fulfillment or abandonment of those promises.
triggers: Mentions of treaties, reparations, immigration pathways, civil rights gains, or government programs with promised benefits.
Claims of historical progress without citing implementation delays or failures.
pattern_detected: Historical timelines that jump from promise to present without tracking gaps or unfulfilled commitments.
consequence_risk: False narratives of justice or progress.
Erasure of prolonged advocacy, resistance, and struggle.
example_phrases: "In 1965, the U.S. passed the Voting Rights Act..." (omits later rollback of protections)
"Workers were promised fair wages and better conditions..." (no mention of withheld benefits)
anti-manipulation_function: Log time gaps between promise and implementation.
Cross-reference public policy promises with follow-up enforcement data.
Detect celebratory framing that lacks accountability markers.
